message_1: A survey was conducted to determine the average height of students in a school. Out of a total of 1000 students in the school, a sample of 100 students were selected and their heights were measured. The average height of the sample was found to be 170 cm with a standard deviation of 10 cm. Find the margin of error for the sample mean at 95% confidence level.
message_2:
To find the margin of error for the sample mean at a 95% confidence level, we will use the formula:

Margin of Error = Z * (Standard Deviation / √Sample Size)

where Z is the Z-score corresponding to the desired confidence level. For a 95% confidence level, the Z-score is approximately 1.96.

Given:
Sample Size (n) = 100 students
Standard Deviation (σ) = 10 cm

Margin of Error = 1.96 * (10 / √100)
Margin of Error = 1.96 * (10 / 10)
Margin of Error = 1.96 * 1
Margin of Error = 1.96 cm

So, the margin of error for the sample mean at a 95% confidence level is approximately 1.96 cm.
